title: New public transport ticketing contract
description: We're modernising with a new ticketing contract to improve the myki system, giving passengers more options when they travel across the state.

title: Public transport for ANZAC Day 2024
description: Public transport services will operate to a public holiday timetable on ANZAC Day, Thursday 25 April.

title: Public transport for the 2024 Easter long weekend
description: Victorian public transport services will be affected by the Easter long weekend. Plan your journey ahead of time.

title: V/Line Industrial Action Withdrawn – Friday 22 March and Thursday 28 March
description: The Rail, Tram and Bus Union has informed V/Line of its agreement to withdraw industrial action planned for Friday 22 March and Thursday 28 March.

title: Extreme heat impacting V/Line train services from Saturday 9 March to Tuesday 12 March 2024
description: Hot weather is forecast for parts of Victoria from Saturday 9 March to Tuesday 12 March 2024. Extreme heat timetables will be operating across parts of the V/Line network.

title: V/Line industrial action Friday 8 March
description: Due to industrial action, there will be significant disruptions to V/Line train services for the entire day on Friday 8 March 2024.

title: Notice of V/Line industrial action on Monday 12, Friday 16, Monday 19 and Friday 23 February
description: The Rail, Tram and Bus Union has notified V/Line of its intention to take industrial action involving a full train network closure between 3am and 7am on Monday 12, Friday 16, Monday 19 and Friday 23 February.

title: Small number of customers impacted by myki overcharge
description: On the 1 January public holiday, a small number of concession myki users did not receive the fare cap they were entitled to, we have reimbursed all impacted customers.

title: Public transport fares from 1 January 2024
description: As of 1 January 2024, public transport fares in Victoria will increase by a weighted average of 5% - in line with the annual Consumer Price Index rise.

title: Avoid morning train travel due to V/Line industrial action on Wednesday 13 December
description: Avoid morning train travel due to V/Line industrial action on Wednesday 13 December

title: Extra trams for special events
description: We’re running extra trams for special events during August and September - times may differ due to traffic congestion around event venues.

title: Public transport for Round 12 of the 2024 AFL Season
description: Extra public transport services for Round 12 of the 2024 AFL season.

title: Public transport for White Night Ballarat 2024
description: White Night returns on 1 June, transforming the streets and venues of Ballarat through illuminations, projections, music, and interactive works.

title: New bus network for Torquay and Armstrong Creek
description: From 2 June 2024, there will be changes to the Geelong, Charlemont, Armstrong Creek, Torquay and Jan Juc bus network.

title: Timetable improvements for Route 606
description: From Sunday 19 May 2024, Route 606 Elsternwick Station – Fishermans Bend will have an improved timetable with more services, longer operating hours and better connections with trains.

title: New bus route for Sunbury and Diggers Rest
description: Starting 24 March, the new bus service, Route 475 Sunbury Station - Diggers Rest Station, will deliver better connections to shops, schools and train stations.

title: Proposed changes to the Gisborne bus network
description: We’re improving the Gisborne bus network and want to hear your feedback on the proposed changes to improve efficiency and meet passenger demands.

title: Changes to Seymour to Albury coach timetable
description: From Saturday 24 February, there will be changes to coach services between Seymour and Albury, with new additional services.

title: Hampton bus interchange relocated
description: From Sunday 4 February, the new Hampton bus interchange will open on Koolkuna Lane, as part of the Hampton Station Precinct development.

title: New timetables for Routes 400, 410, 420 and 422
description: From Monday 29 January, we’re introducing new timetables to bus routes from Sunshine Station - Route 400, Route 410, 420 and Route 422.

title: New bus service to connect Donnybrook and Craigieburn stations
description: From 7 January 2024, Route 501 Donnybrook Station – Craigieburn Station via Hume Fwy will provide a fast and frequent connection between regional and metro train services. There will also be a timetable change to Route 511 which will come into effect on the same day.

title: Better bus and train connections in Craigieburn and the wider Hume area
description: From 7 January 2024, Route 390 Mernda Station – Craigieburn Station via Wollert will start earlier and finish later.

title: Faster and more direct travel along Camp Road in Broadmeadows
description: The Department of Transport and Planning is making improvements to Route 538, meaning a number of changes to the route.

title: Upgraded service for Route 631 and removal of Route 821
description: From 3 December, Route 631 will realign from Old Dandenong Road to Clayton Road which will deliver additional services and boost weekday frequency.

title: New bus interchange on the south side of Tarneit Railway Station
description: From 19 November 2023, a new bus interchange will begin operating on the south side of Tarneit Railway Station.

title: Upcoming improvements to the Yarra Valley bus network
description: From 26 November 2023, changes to the Yarra Valley bus network for routes 684, 685, 686 and 687 will be introduced.

title: Extra bus services to Chadstone Shopping Centre connecting to trains and trams
description: We're introducing two additional shuttle bus services to accommodate travel to and from Chadstone Shopping Centre during spring and summer shopping.

title: Timetable changes to Route 235 and Route 237
description: Fishermans Bend bus routes 235 and 237 will start and end at Southern Cross Station from October 2023. Services will be boosted and operation increased.

title: Better buses for Deakin, Burwood and Box Hill
description: Changes on the Box Hill, Burwood and Deakin University bus routes will improve connectivity, simplify the network and boost services.

title: Better buses for Casey
description: From Sunday 26 June 2023, improvements will be introduced on bus routes 863 and 895 in the City of Casey.

title: New bus timetables from Sunday 28 May 2023
Improvements to the Yarra Valley bus network
description: Following community consultation, DTP is making improvements to the Yarra Valley bus network. These changes affect Route 684, 685, 686 and 687.

title: Changes to Kilmore Town Service (Link Bus)
description: We’re proposing changes to bus routes 631 and 821.

title: More services for routes 733 and 767
description: From 30 April 2023, more services will be introduced on bus routes 733 and 767.

title: Changes to bus routes 200, 305, 309 and 905
description: From 30 April 2023, there will be changes to bus routes 200, 305, 309 and 905 due to the opening of Bulleen Park and Ride.

title: We’re proposing changes to routes 631 and 821
description: We’re proposing changes to bus routes 631 and 821.

title: Route 624 school deviation
description: From Monday 30 January 2023, Route 624 will make one AM and one PM route deviation to drop off and pick up students attending Ashwood High School.

title: Changes to Bendigo – Shepparton via Kyabram route
description: From Sunday 29 January 2023, the Bendigo – Shepparton via Kyabram bus route will have a new timetable.

title: Colac Route 3 timetable and minor route change
description: From Sunday 29 January 2023, Colac Route 3 will have a timetable and minor route change.

title: Route 505 extra weekday trips
description: From 12 February 2023, 13 additional services will be introduced on weekdays during the morning and evening peak periods, as well as during the interpeak.

title: Changes to Berwick Station Bus Interchange
description: On 30 Oct 2022, a new bus interchange opened on the southern side of Berwick Station, near Kangan Dive & Clyde Road.

title: Improved bus links between Alexandra and Eildon
description: From Monday 21 November 2022, the Alexandra to Eildon bus service will be boosted to operate every weekday.

title: Bus service to connect Smythesdale, Smythes Creek, Haddon and Snake Valley to Delacombe Town Centre
description: From November 2022, bus route Ballarat-Snake Valley via Haddon will be transformed to connect residents to Delacombe Town Centre.

title: Minor bus timetable changes for Wallan
description: From Oct 2022, there will be minor timetable changes for Wallan bus routes to provide better connections with the new Shepparton Line timetable.

title: New coach timetable along the Shepparton Line
description: From 23 Oct 2022, coach services along the Shepparton Line will be re-coordinated to improve connections with the new Shepparton Line timetable.

title: New Sunday bus service for Kilmore
description: From 23 Oct 2022, the Kilmore Town Service will be expanded to operate on Sundays, replicating the existing Saturday timetable.

title: More weekend buses are coming to the Macedon Ranges
description: From Oct 2022, additional weekend services will be added to the Lancefield – Sunbury, Lancefield – Gisborne and Lancefield – Kyneton routes.

title: Let's Go with more buses between the city and Fishermans Bend
description: From Oct 2022, a turn up and go service will operate on Route 235 City - Fishermans Bend via Williamstown Rd & Route 237 City - Fishermans Bend via Lorimer St.

title: Bus changes are coming to Clyde and Clyde North
description: From Sunday 28 August, bus Routes 897 and 898 will be extended to Clyde North to provide better coverage and access to schools, shops and train stations.

title: Timetable and route path changes for Glenrowan, Wangaratta and Yarrawonga bus services
description: From Sunday 28 August, bus Routes 897 and 898 will be extended to Clyde North to provide better coverage and access to schools, shops and train stations.

title: More frequent buses on Route 390
description: From 7 August, Route 390 Mernda Station – Craigieburn Station via Wollert buses will run more frequently, improving connections with other transport services.

title: Minor route path change to bus Route 182
description: From 26 June 2022, Route 182 will have a minor route change due to the completion of the Hogans Road bridge in Tarneit.

title: Changes to Glenroy Station bus services
description: From July 2022, minor route and stop changes will be made to bus Routes 513, 534, and 951 so buses can access the new Glenroy Station bus interchange.

title: Minor route and timetable change for bus Route 15
description: From 3 July 2022, buses between Ballarat Station and Brown Hill will travel via Fussell and Charlesworth Street.

title: Changes to the Wyndham bus network
description: From 26 June 2022, there will be minor timetable and route path changes on bus services across the City of Wyndham.

title: Bus and coach timetable adjustments for improved travel on the Geelong and Warrnambool lines
description: From May 2022, the timetable for a number of bus and coach services will change to maintain connections along the Geelong and Warrnambool lines.

title: Minor timetable changes for bus stops across the Latrobe Valley bus network
description: From June 2022, some bus stops across routes 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12, 13, 14, 15, 21, 22, 30, 40, 41, 42 and 45 will have minor timetable changes.

title: Minor route path changes to bus routes 706, 857, 858 and 902
description: From Sunday 24 April 2022, as part of the Level Crossing Removal Project, the Chelsea bus interchange will relocate 270 metres south on Station Street.

title: Changes to bus network in Craigieburn area
description: Changes are being made to bus routes 511, 525, 528, 529, 530, 531, 532, 533, 537 and 544 around the Craigieburn area.

title: FlexiRide comes to the Mornington Peninsula
description: From February 2022, we’re introducing the new on-demand bus service FlexiRide to the Mornington Peninsula and making changes to Route 787 and Route 886.

title: Improved bus services for Mornington Peninsula
description: From Sunday 2022, Routes 781 and 887 will be upgraded to better connect residents and tourists.

title: Timetable adjustments for improved travel on the Cranbourne Line
description: From 13 Feb 2022, the timetable for a number of buses and coaches will change to maintain connections with the adjusted timetable along the Cranbourne Line.

title: Minor route deviation and timetable change for bus Route 626
description: From Jan 2022, Route 626 will deviate one AM and one PM service via East Boundary Road to provide better transport access to McKinnon Secondary College.

title: New bus service to connect Merinda Park Station and Clyde North
description: Route 881 Merinda Park Station to Clyde North will provide coverage for the first time to residents living along St Germain Blvd & Thompsons Rd.

title: Minor timetable adjustments for Lilydale bus services
description: From Jan 2022, there will be minor timetable adjustments for Lilydale bus routes 683, 684 and 685 to allow for better train connections.

title: New bus interchange and better bus services for Ballarat
description: From Sunday 19 December 2021, Ballarat bus services will use the new bus interchange making it safer and easier to connect with trains at Ballarat Station.

title: New bus Route 816 Keysborough South to Noble Park Station and timetable changes to Route 813
description: From 28 Nov 2021, new bus Route 816 Keysborough South - Noble Park Station will be introduced to the network.

title: More frequent buses for Route 525
description: From Nov 2021, Route 525 will run more frequently, giving residents from Craigieburn, Donnybrook, Kalkallo & Mickleham more travel options.

title: Better buses for Mornington Peninsula
description: From Nov 2021, Route 788 Frankston to Portsea will run more frequently giving Mornington Peninsula residents and tourists more options on when to travel.

title: New bus service between Mernda and Craigieburn stations
description: From Sunday 31 October 2021, new bus Route 390 will connect people living in Mernda and Wollert with train services at Mernda and Craigieburn.

title: Additional services on Route 381 for St Helena Secondary College students
description: From 4 October 2021, additional AM and PM services will be introduced on Route 381 Mernda Station to Diamond Creek Station.

title: On-demand bus service FlexiRide expands to Chirnside Park, Lilydale, Mooroolbark and Croydon
description: From 4 Oct 2021, the new Lilydale FlexiRide service will help residents in Chirnside Park, Lilydale, Mooroolbark & Croydon get to their destinations.

title: New bus service for Uni Melb and Parkville Precinct and changes to Route 546
description: A new bus service Route 202 Yarra Bend to Melbourne University will better connect Victoria Park Station to the UoM & Parkville’s medical precinct.

title: Changes to timetables for metropolitan bus services
description: From September 2021, changes will be made to the timetables of 19 bus routes in metropolitan Melbourne to make services more efficient and better aligned.

title: Minor route change for bus routes 511, 525 and Seymour Night Coach
description: From Aug 2021, bus routes 511, 525 and Seymour Night Coach will access Donnybrook Station Bus Interchange via an altered route.

title: Timetable change for the connection of Horsham bus Route 5 with the Overland train
description: From 28 Aug 2021, the temporary timetable for Horsham bus Route 5 will become permanent, providing connections with the Overland rail.

title: ePaper Real Time Information
description: Trial our new information display and complete our short survey on your experiences using it. Your answers will help us shape projects and services.

title: Croydon Station Bus Interchange safety project
description: We’re upgrading the Croydon Station Bus Interchange to improve pedestrian safety. Works are scheduled to take place over two weeks from 16 February 2022.

title: New station at East Pakenham
description: From Monday 3 June 2024, Pakenham Line services will be extended to East Pakenham Station.

title: Flinders Street Station upgrade
description: The Flinders Street Station Upgrade is being delivered in two programs: repair & restoration to the main building and works to improve the passenger experience.

title: South Yarra Station Upgrade
description: Improvements to the South Yarra Station entrance & construction of an accessible tram stop on Toorak Road will allow passengers an easier and safer journey.

title: Watergardens Station accessibility upgrade
description: We’re building three new lifts at Watergardens Station, to help people move around the station precinct and catch the train more easily.

title: Statement of Freight Network Capability
description: The Statement of Freight Network Capability clearly states the rail network’s capability and when it's available for carrying goods.

title: Myki expiry extension
description: We've listened to feedback and are extending the life of eligible myki cards that have recently expired or are about to expire by 2 years.

title: Metropolitan Zero Emission Bus (ZEB) Franchises Pre Qualification
description: We're inviting organisations to pre-qualify for participation in an upcoming procurement process for the Metropolitan ZEB Franchises Project.

description: Public transport fares will increase from 1 July 2023.

description: From Monday 30 October 2023, there will be timetable changes for routes 1, 3, 5, 6, 11, 12, 16, 35, 58, 64, 67, 72, 78, 86, and 109.

title: Tram timetable changes in April 2023
description: From Sunday 16 April 2023, there will be minor changes to journey times and timetables on the Williams, Flinders and Collins street tram corridors.

title: New tram timetables in October 2022
description: From Sunday 19 December, routes 11, 12, 19, 48, 57, 58, 59, 75, 78, 82, 96 and 109 will have new timetables as we introduce E-Class trams on Route 58.

title: Route 58 infrastructure upgrades
description: We’re upgrading Melbourne’s tram network to deliver accessible transport and meet Melbourne’s future transport needs.

title: Gardiner tram substation
description: We’re revitalising Melbourne’s tram network, meeting the city’s future needs and increased demands on the tram network.

title: Routes 82 and 86 Tram Corridor Development Project
description: We’re changing the way we plan tram stop upgrades to support more inclusive and equitable access to tram travel for more passengers.

title: Reservoir substation
description: Artist’s impression of Reservoir substation. Subject to change.

title: Glenferrie Road bridge upgrade works
description: The Victorian Government invested $4.9 million from the 2021/22 State Budget to complete the bridge strengthening and tram track renewal works on Glenferrie Road between Como Street and Station Street in Malvern.

title: Parkville substation
description: We’re upgrading Melbourne’s tram power network to meet the city’s future transport needs and increased demands on the network.

title: Brunswick depot precinct upgrade
description: We’re adding more trams to the network to keep Melbourne moving. To get more trams on the network, we need to upgrade the Brunswick Tram Depot.

title: Introduction to tram substations
description: Tram substations contain electrical equipment to convert the local power supply into the voltage needed to run the tram network.

title: Gardiners Creek bridge upgrade works
description: From 10pm Friday 21 January to 5am Saturday 29 January, Glenferrie Road, between Toorak Road and Riversdale Road in Kooyong will be closed for essential bridge upgrade and tram track renewal works.

title: Tram stop upgrade – Stop 4, William Street/Collins Street
description: We’re upgrading Stop 4, William/Collins Street, to create raised side platforms, integrated with Melbourne’s expanding fleet of low-floor trams.

title: Merri Creek bridge upgrade works
description: From 12am Sunday 28 November to 5am Monday 6 December, High Street between Westgarth Street and Hoddle Street in Northcote will be closed for essential bridge upgrade and tram track renewal works.Hight St works map

title: Tram stop enhancement works
description: As part of the Victorian Government’s $328.4 million investment into critical public transport and road maintenance upgrades to create and support more than 600 jobs, we’re delivering a range of safety and operational improvements across Melbourne’s iconic tram network.This $2.5 million program of improvements will deliver upgrades at over 80 stops.

title: La Trobe Street tram stop upgrade
description: We're delivering 12 level-access tram stops at six locations along La Trobe Street to improve accessibility, passenger safety and service reliability.We're delivering 12 level-access tram stops at six locations along La Trobe Street to improve accessibility, passenger safety and service reliability.

title: Improving connectivity at Merinda Park Station
description: We’ve improved accessibility for public transport users at Merinda Park Station with a new bus interchange, upgraded commuter car parking and pedestrian access improvements.

title: Melbourne Tram Refranchising

description: Footy fever is upon us again as Melbourne gears up for the 2024 AFL Grand Final at the ‘G’. Footy fever is upon us again as Melbourne gears up for the 2024 AFL Grand Final at the ‘G’.

title: Public transport for the Melbourne Royal Show: Thursday 26 September to Sunday 6 October 2024
description: We're running extra trams and trains to get passengers to all the fun and excitement of the Melbourne Royal Show!

title: Public transport for Listen Out
description: Listen Out is on at Caribbean Gardens! Public transport is your best way to enjoy it. We're running extra services to help you get to and from the event on Friday 27th September.

title: Extra trams for special events
description: We’re running extra trams for the events below events during September and October. While trams run to their normal frequency, times may differ due to traffic congestion around event venues. Please allow extra time for your journey.

title: Public transport for the 2024 / 2025 cruise ship season
description: We extend a warm welcome to all cruise ship passengers arriving at Station Pier in Port Melbourne.

title: Free travel for Veterans and War Widows during the 2024 Veterans’ Health Week
description: Victorian Veterans and War Widows can explore Melbourne and regional Victoria with free travel during the Veterans’ Health Week from Sunday 13 October to Sunday 20 October 2024.

title: Public transport for the NRL Preliminary Final – Melbourne Storm v Sydney Roosters
description: NRL Finals are on at AAMI Park! This matchup is sure to deliver edge-of-your-seat action and public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne Storm takes on the Sydney Roosters. Extra services will help you get to and from AAMI Park on Friday 27 September.

title: Public transport for the 2024 / 2025 cruise ship season
description: We extend a warm welcome to all cruise ship passengers arriving at Station Pier in Port Melbourne.

title: Public transport for Caulfield Guineas Cup Day: Saturday 12th October 2024
description: Extra public transport services are running from Caulfield Racecourse for the Caulfield Guineas Cup Day on Saturday 12 October 2024.

title: Public transport for Turnbull Stakes Day
description: We're running extra services to and from Sofitel Makybe Diva Stakes Race day on Saturday 14 September.

title: Public transport for The Weeknd in Concert
description: The Weeknd has arrived in Melbourne, set to take to the stage at Marvel Stadium! We're running extra services to and from Marvel Stadium on Saturday 5 and Sunday 6 October.

title: Public transport for Monster Jam: Saturday 5 October 2024
description: Monster Jam returns to AAMI Park and public transport is your best way to enjoy it! We're running extra services to get you to and from AAMI Park on Saturday 5 October.

title: Information about myki auto top up emails
description: We’re aware of a technical issue causing some customers to have received duplicate email notifications after their myki was topped…

title: Timetable and route path changes for routes 603, 604 and 605
description: From 20 October 2024, bus routes 603, 604 and 605 will have new timetables and route path changes following the reopening of the roads around Anzac Station.

title: Public transport for the 2024 Melbourne Marathon
description: The Melbourne Marathon is back this Sunday 15 October for the 46th anniversary of this annual event.

title: New Domain Road Stops
description: In the coming months, bus Route 605 will extend further along Domain Road with two new stops.

title: Public transport for Stray Kids World Tour
description: Global K-Pop superstars Stray Kids are set to thrill Australian fans this October with a one night only performance at Marvel Stadium as part of their <dominATE> World Tour. This follows the release of the group's new mini album ATE, the 8-track offering taking the world by storm! We're running extra services to get to and from Marvel Stadium on Saturday 19 October 2024.

title: Public transport for Caulfield Cup Day: Saturday 19 October 2024
description: Extra public transport services are running from Caulfield Racecourse for the Caulfield Cup Day on Saturday 19 October 2024

title: Improved Torquay and Armstrong Creek bus network
description: The improved bus network in Geelong, Charlemont, Armstrong Creek, Torquay and Jan Juc is matching travel demands of the local communities by creating better coordinated, frequent and reliable bus services with improved access to jobs, education, shops and health facilities.

title: Public transport for the SSAA Shot Expo: Saturday 19th and Sunday 20th October 2024
description: We're running extra services to get you to and from the 2024 SSAA SHOT Expo at the Melbourne Showgrounds on Saturday 19 and Sunday 20 October.

title: Public transport for Travis Scott – Circus Maximus Tour: Tuesday 22 and Wednesday 23 October 2024
description: We're running extra services to and from Listen Out on Friday 27 September.

title: Scheduled myki maintenance Saturday 26 October, 12am to 6am
description: myki accounts, online top ups and instant top ups through PTV app and Google Wallet will be unavailable while planned software updates take place on Saturday 26 October, 12am to 6am.

title: Public transport for the Dog & Cat Lover’s Festival
description: We're running extra services for the Dog & Cat Lover’s Festival at the Melbourne Showgrounds on Saturday 26 and Sunday 27 October.

description: Extra public transport services are running from and to the Moonee Valley Racecourse on Friday 25 October and Saturday 26 October 2024.

title: Public transport for the A-League Round 2 - Melbourne City v Melbourne Victory: Saturday 26 October 2024
description: A-League is back at AAMI Park. This matchup is sure to deliver edge-of-your-seat action. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne City FC takes on the Melbourne Victory. Extra services will help you get to and from AAMI Park on Saturday 26th October.
